rules: Headings must never use Inter. Use Manrope.
Use tight tracking (-0.02em) for headings larger than 24px.
Use relaxed leading (1.6) for body text to improve readability.
Uppercase labels must use tracking-widest (0.1em) and text-xs.

background.description: Pure White for main surfaces, Slate-50 for app background

accent.description: Sky Blue for highlights and progress bars

instructions_to_main_agent: STRICTLY follow the 'Corporate Clean' theme. No gradients on backgrounds.
Use the defined 'Blue' (#2563EB) for all primary actions. Do not use the old Indigo.
Ensure the Sidebar is Dark (#1E293B) with light text.
Data Tables must look professional: distinct header row, borders, alternating row colors on hover.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'Inter' for body text.
Maintain generous spacing (p-6 or p-8) inside containers.
Do not use 'transparent' backgrounds for dropdowns or headers.
For the 'Tino AI' assistant, preserve the existing animations in index.css but ensure they fit the new color scheme.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) sparingly (only for overlays/modals).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: `transition: all`. This results in breaking transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
